comments.body: shouldn't you just leave all of the tests that you set ``transpose=False`` and instead just use ``box_transpose_fail``? so it tests both branches and only fails on the True?

Two issues make this a PITA.  First, this uses `box_with_period`, so we would need a separate `box_with_period_transpose_fail` and same for `box_with_datetime_transpose_fail`.  And for the latter it is even worse because most of those tests use `tz_naive_fixture`, where only one of those cases fails in the `box=DataFrame, transpose=True` case.  For the time being I think  the xfails+comments in this PR are enough to keep us acutely aware of the outstanding issues.

        expected = tm.box_expected(expected, box, transpose=False)
